Package halfpastnoon.sys

Class Organism

  • java.lang.Object
    • halfpastnoon.sys.Organism
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Crop
    public abstract class Organism
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract class for all living organisms, i.e. crops and livestock.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      float hydration
      Represents the level of hydration of the organism.
      float nutrition
      Represents the level of nutrition of the organism.
      java.lang.String species
      The name of the species of the organism.
      Examples may include "Corn" or "Cow".
      int stage
      Represents the stage in life of the organism.

    • Field Detail

      • stage

        public int stage
        Represents the stage in life of the organism. The stage property should be manipulated such that the organism is considered alive when stage >= 0 is true (and, conversely, is considered dead when stage < 0 is true).

      • hydration

        public float hydration
        Represents the level of hydration of the organism. Nothing "validates" the value of hydration, but ideally it should be in the range [0.0, 100.0] (i.e. 0.0 <= hydration && hydration <= 100.0 is true)

      • nutrition

        public float nutrition
        Represents the level of nutrition of the organism. Ought to be used in the same manner as hydration.

      • species

        public java.lang.String species
        The name of the species of the organism.
        Examples may include "Corn" or "Cow".

    • Constructor Detail

      • Organism

        public Organism​(java.lang.String species)
        Default constructor. Initializes a new Organism such that its properties represents a crop that was just planted.
        Parameters:
        species - the species of the plant

      • Organism

        public Organism​(Organism o)
        Copy constructor. Initializes a new Organism with the same properties as the specified Organism. However, all values are initialized such that they represent a new organism (i.e. a freshly planted seed or a newborn animal). The intented use of this constructor is to make "cloning" a given organism easy.
        Parameters:
        o - the Organism being copied from.

      • Organism

        public Organism​(int s,
                float hy,
                float nu,
                java.lang.String sp)
        Initializes a new Organism with the specified properties.
        Parameters:
        s - the stage of life the organism is in.
        hy - percent hydration of the organism.
        nu - percent nutrition of the organism.
        sp - the species of the organism.

    • Method Detail

      • isAlive

        public boolean isAlive()
        Determines if the organism is alive; i.e. evaluate stage >= 0.
        Returns:
        true is the organism is alive or false if it is dead.
